remarks: Alternative way to express the predicate " ` W ` is Archimedean ", for Tosets.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 30-Jan-2018.)
statement:
isarchi2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` W ) $.
isarchi2.0 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` W ) $.
isarchi2.x $e |- .x. = ( .g ` W ) $.
isarchi2.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` W ) $.
isarchi2.t $e |- .< = ( lt ` W ) $.
isarchi2 $p |- ( ( W e. Toset /\ W e. Mnd ) -> ( W e. Archi <-> A. x e. B A. y e. B ( .0. .< x -> E. n e. NN y .<_ ( n .x. x ) ) ) ) $.
$d B n x y $.
$d W n x y $.
